Class DMagic

  • java.lang.Object
    • DMagic

  • public class DMagic
extends java.lang.Object
    Dictionary Macic (DMagic) is a set of utilities for manipulating a dictionary list of words and performing search and sort operations on them.

    DMagic can also handle the loading of dictionary lists to and from various file formats.

    See Also:
    File

      • dropFromList

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> dropFromList(java.util.List<java.lang.String> inputList,
                                            int dropPercent)
        dropFromList will create a new List with only (100-propPercent) out of every 100 words included in the List.
        Parameters:
        inputList - The origional list to create the sub-list with.
        dropPercent - The number out of 100 of items to not include in the new sub-list.
        Returns:
        A sub-list containing (100-dropPercent)% of the inputList
        See Also:
        String

      • trimShortWords

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> trimShortWords(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> inputList,
                                              int minLength)
        trimShortWords will create a new List with only the words from the origional Collection that have a length of at least minLength.
        Parameters:
        inputList - The origional list to create the sub-list with.
        minLength - The minimum length of a string to be included in the new sub-list.
        Returns:
        A sub-list containing Strings from inputList of minLength length or longer.
        See Also:
        Collection String

      • findPalendromePairs

        public static void findPalendromePairs(java.util.List<java.lang.String> wordList,
                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> anagramPairs)
        findPalendromePairs will append to the supplied Map pairs of words from the origional List that form a pair of words which form a palendrome when concatenated together, for example "dog" and "god".
        Parameters:
        wordList - The origional list to create the Map with.
        anagramPairs - This is the Map into which the found pairs will be added, it must be initialized, but does not have to be empty.

      • findSymetricPairs

        public static void findSymetricPairs(java.util.List<java.lang.String> wordList,
                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> symetricPairs)
        findSymetricPairs will append to the supplied Map pairs of words from the origional List that form a pair of words which form a visual palendrome when concatenated together, for example "bob" and "dod".
        Parameters:
        wordList - The origional list to create the Map with.
        symetricPairs - This is the Map into which the found pairs will be added, it must be initialized, but does not have to be empty.

      • groupAnagrams

        public static void groupAnagrams(java.util.List<java.lang.String> wordList,
                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> anagramGroups)
        groupAnagrams will append to the supplied Map groups of words from the origional List which form a group of angrams, the Map is keyed with the alphabetical ordering of the letters. eg. "cat", and "tac" would both be placed in the same group and keyed with "act".
        Parameters:
        wordList - The origional list to create the Map and groups with.
        anagramGroups - This is the Map into which the found groups will be added, it must be initialized, but does not have to be empty.

      • printResultList

        public static void printResultList(java.util.List<java.lang.String> printList,
                   java.lang.String title)
        printResultList is a convinience method to simply print the supplied List with a given heading.
        Parameters:
        printList - The list to be formatted and displayed.
        title - The title to be included in the output.

        public static void printPairResultList(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> printList,
                       java.lang.String title)
        printResultList is a convinience method to simply print the supplied Map with a given heading.
        Parameters:
        printList - The map to be formatted and displayed.
        title - The title to be included in the output.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> randomTenSearch(java.util.List<java.lang.String> wordHashSet,
                                               java.util.Random rng)
        randomTenSearch creates a List of 10 random elements from a List.
        Parameters:
        wordHashSet - The List to be searched.
        rng - The random number generator to use.
        Returns:
        A List of 10 random elements.

      • palendromeSearch

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> palendromeSearch(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> wordHashSet)
        palendromeSearch will create a new List of words from the origional Collection that are palendromes.
        Parameters:
        wordHashSet - The origional Collection to create the List with.
        Returns:
        A list of the palendromes from the origional Collection.

      • longestLine

        public static java.lang.String longestLine(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> wordList)
        longestLine will search a Collection of Strings and return the longest String it finds.
        Parameters:
        wordList - The origional Collection to search.
        Returns:
        The longest String found in the Collection.

      • isPalendrome

        public static boolean isPalendrome(java.lang.String inputString)
        isPalendrome will check if the input String is a palendrome and returns true if it is and false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        inputString - The String to check.
        Returns:
        True if the input is a palendrome and false otherwise.

      • readWordList

        public static int readWordList(java.io.File wordFile,
               java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> wordHashSet)
        readWordList takes a File and a HashSet as paramaters and reads each word from the File and inserts it into the HashSet.

        Duplicate words are not inserted, only lower case words are inserted.

        Parameters:
        wordFile - The file to read the word list from.
        wordHashSet - The HashSet to write words into.
        Returns:
        A count of how many words were entered.

      • readWordList

        public static int readWordList(java.io.File wordFile,
               java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.String> wordHashSet)
        readWordList takes a File and a TreeSet as paramaters and reads each word from the File and inserts it into the TreeSet.

        Duplicate words are not inserted, only lower case words are inserted.

        Parameters:
        wordFile - The file to read the word list from.
        wordHashSet - The TreeSet to write words into.
        Returns:
        A count of how many words were entered.

      • readWordList

        public static int readWordList(java.io.File wordFile,
               java.util.LinkedHashSet<java.lang.String> wordHashSet)
        readWordList takes a File and a LinkedHashSet as paramaters and reads each word from the File and inserts it into the LinkedHashSet.

        Duplicate words are not inserted, only lower case words are inserted.

        Parameters:
        wordFile - The file to read the word list from.
        wordHashSet - The LinkedHashSet to write words into.
        Returns:
        A count of how many words were entered.

        Duplicate words are not inserted, only lower case words are inserted.

        Parameters:

        wordHashSet - The List to write words into.
